name: Method for color schemes
description:
This is a slightly backwards method for creating color schemes. Instead of defining an array of shades up front, it provides a way to do it as you go - in a sustainable, systematic manner and without making a mess.


This method also suggests how to define colors in dev.


Pros

  • It's a method! Once you learn it, it's easy to apply and keep colors nice and tidy. And methods are especially useful for teams so that everyone's on the same page.
  • It's flexible! There's probably not going to be a situation where you can't create a light-enough or dark-enough variation.
  • For devs, if a base color changes, you only need to change one variable to update everything.
  • Any new color remains harmonious with the base color scheme


Cons

  • For designers, if a base color changes, you may need to do quite a bit of updates (since base color is detached in color mixes). Maybe there's a plugin to quickly do it...
  • Naming isn't exactly meaningful.
  • Naming may not make sense if a color gets too light or too dark.
